summary: The 5 permanently inhabited U.S. territories borrow through financial markets to fund infrastructure projects and government operations. We review the territories' public debt every 2 years. We found that outstanding public debt has increased relative to the size of the economy in Puerto Rico, American Samoa, and the U.S. Virgin Islands. title: U.S. Territories: Public Debt Outlook – 2021 Update
